hanzi-su-wiki:
線

Значения

Линяя, черта

Мнемоника

Источник 泉 линии есть нитка 糸, она такая же прямая.

Варианты

缐, 綫, 线

heisig_chinese_memo: Spiderman does a hot spring tour of Japan using the train lines.
heisig_constituent: line, thread, spiderman, spring, white, dove, water
koohiiStory1: This kanji is used for train lines. Spiderman does a hot spring tour of Japan using the train lines. You can see the Spidey costume hanging on the washing line as he enjoys the onsen.
koohiiStory2: Japan´s train lines are like threads that spring from Tokyo station.
jp_example_words:
沿線(えんせん): along railway line
幹線(かんせん): main line, trunk line
三味線(さみせん): three-stringed Japanese guitar, shamisen
点線(てんせん): dotted line, perforated line
電線(でんせん): electric line
無線(むせん): wireless, radio
下線(かせん): underline
曲線(きょくせん): curve
光線(こうせん): beam, light ray
新幹線(しんかんせん): bullet train
水平線(すいへいせん): horizon
線路(せんろ): line, track, roadbed

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If someone falls overboard while you're white water rafting, you can use a long piece of thread as a life line. Sure it might be thin, but a line of thread is better than nothing. Throw them a line and drag them back aboard! Those white water rapids are vicious.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine you're the person who fell overboard. The white water is rushing violently and it is deathly cold. Feel the water and freezing temperature on your skin. But look! Someone has thrown you a line of thread! You're saved!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The person who threw you that line of thread is actually a centaur (せん). How kind of him. After you are safe you hop on the centaur's back and ride around to get the wind to dry you off.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Coming out of the rushing water, this centaur is like an angel sent from heaven. He's just saved your life. Imagine the happiness and gratitude you feel towards this centaur as you are pulled to safety by that line of thread.
Ru_Radicals: 小 (маленький), 幺 (короткая нить), 水 (вода), 白 (белый), 糸 (нить)
Ru_trainchinese:
xiàn: (сущ/сч.слово) нить, струна; хлопок, шерсть; транспортный путь, трасса; (геом.) линия; (с абстрактными существительными) немного
xiàn: (графема) провод; ключ к разгадке; граница; край, грань; идеологическая или политическая линия
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the thread (糸) in the spring (泉) looks like a line
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A line of floats can be connected with strong thread to make a fun water ride for the children.
humanum_full_description_en:
Same as " thread " (from "糸", "戋" sound), the original meaning is a thread made of cotton, wool, silk, hemp, metal and other materials. "Said Wen": "Law also. From Shito, twisting sound. Thread, ancient writing thread." "Zhou Li‧Tian Guan‧Sewing People": "The stitching of people in the hands of the palace." Zheng Xuan quoted Zheng Sinong Said: "Thread, thread also."

" Line " can mean something slender like a line. "Farewell Poem" by Liang Fanyun of the Southern Dynasty: "Dongfeng Willow Line is Long."

" Line " can also be used as a quantifier, and the number is limited to " one " to indicate subtlety. One of Tang Dufu's "Zhi Riqianxing Fongji Old Old House and Old Friend": "Whoever remembers the days of poverty and sorrow, the sorrows follow the long line."
humanum_short_description_en: Same as " thread " (from "糸", "戋" sound), the original meaning is a thread made of cotton, wool, silk, hemp, metal and other materials.
humanum_full_description:
同「綫」（從「糸」，「戔」聲），本義為用棉、毛、絲、麻、金屬等材料製成的細縷。《說文》：「縷也。从糸，戔聲。線，古文綫。」《周禮‧天官‧縫人》：「縫人掌王宮之縫線之事。」鄭玄注引鄭司農曰：「線，縷也。」

　　「線」可表示細長如線的東西。南朝梁范雲〈送別詩〉：「東風柳線長。」

　　「線」還可用作量詞，數詞限用「一」，表示細微。唐杜甫〈至日遣興奉寄舊閣老兩院故人〉之一：「何人卻憶窮愁日，日日愁隨一線長。」
humanum_short_description: 同「綫」（從「糸」，「戔」聲），本義為用棉、毛、絲、麻、金屬等材料製成的細縷。

Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 泉 indicates the sound; 糹 (thread) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 糹 [ sī ] silk; thread
    • 泉 [ quán ] spring, fountain; wealth, money
①用絲、棉、麻、金屬等製成的細長可以任意曲折的東西：絲線。棉線。線圈。線材。線繩。
②幾何學上指一個點任意移動所構成的圖形：直線。曲線。線條。
③像線的東西：光線。視線。線索(a。事情的頭緒或門徑；b。文學作品中情節發展的脈絡或文章的思路)。戰線。生命線。
④量詞，用於抽象事物，數詞限用“一”，表示極少：一線希望。
線路 [ xiàn lù ]: line; circuit; wire; road; railway track; bus route

同「 綫 」（從「 糸 」，「 戔 」聲），本義為用棉、毛、絲、麻、金屬等材料製成的細縷。《說文》：「縷也。从糸，戔聲。線，古文綫。」《周禮‧天官‧縫人》：「縫人掌王宮之縫線之事。」鄭玄注引鄭司農曰：「線，縷也。」 「 線 」可表示細長如線的東西。南朝梁范雲〈送別詩〉：「東風柳線長。」 「 線 」還可用作量詞，數詞限用「 一 」，表示細微。唐杜甫〈至日遣興奉寄舊閣老兩院故人〉之一：「何人卻憶窮愁日，日日愁隨一線長。」
Same as " thread" (from " 糸", " 戋" sound), the original meaning is a thread made of cotton, wool, silk, hemp, metal and other materials. "Said Wen": "Law also. From Shito, twisting sound. Thread, ancient writing thread." "Zhou Li‧Tian Guan‧Sewing People": "The stitching of people in the hands of the palace." Zheng Xuan quoted Zheng Sinong Said: "Thread, thread also." " Line" can mean something slender like a line. "Farewell Poem" by Liang Fanyun of the Southern Dynasty: "Dongfeng Willow Line is Long." " Line" can also be used as a quantifier, and the number is limited to " one" to indicate subtlety. One of Tang Dufu's "Zhi Riqianxing Fongji Old Old House and Old Friend": "Whoever remembers the days of poverty and sorrow, the sorrows follow the long line."

線字的基本解释

線
xiàn
同“线”。
姓。

線字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xiàn］
亦作“絤1”。同“綫1”。“缐1”的繁体字。

線字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　線； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页930第05
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】?私箭切，音綫。【正韻】先見切，音霰。【說文】綫，古文作線。【周禮·天官】縫人掌王宫縫線之事。【註】線，縷也。又【冬官·考工記·鞄人】察其線，欲其藏也。【註】謂縫車之縷。【集韻】亦作絤?。

線字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

暂无。

xiàn
вм. 线
Radicals: 糸, 白, 水  (thread, white, water)
Meaning Mnemonic
If someone falls overboard while you're white water rafting, you can use a long piece of thread as a life line. Sure it might be thin, but a line of thread is better than nothing. Throw them a line and drag them back aboard! Those white water rapids are vicious.
Imagine you're the person who fell overboard. The white water is rushing violently and it is deathly cold. Feel the water and freezing temperature on your skin. But look! Someone has thrown you a line of thread! You're saved!
Reading Mnemonic
The person who threw you that line of thread is actually a centaur (せん). How kind of him. After you are safe you hop on the centaur's back and ride around to get the wind to dry you off.
Coming out of the rushing water, this centaur is like an angel sent from heaven. He's just saved your life. Imagine the happiness and gratitude you feel towards this centaur as you are pulled to safety by that line of thread.
